members.name: IDBKeyRange.lower
members.description: Lower bound of the key range.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.upper
members.description: Upper bound of the key range.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.lowerOpen
members.description: Returns false if the lower-bound value is included in the key range.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.upperOpen
members.description: Returns false if the upper-bound value is included in the key range.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.bound()
members.description: Creates a new key range with upper and lower bounds.

parameters.name: lower
parameters.description: specifies the lower bound of the new key range.

parameters.name: upper
parameters.description: specifies the upper bound of the new key range.

parameters.name: lowerOpen Optional
parameters.description: indicates whether the lower bound excludes the endpoint value. The default is false.

parameters.name: upperOpen Optional
parameters.description: Indicates whether the upper bound excludes the endpoint value. The default is false.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.only()
members.description: Creates a new key range containing a single value.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.lowerBound()
members.description: Creates a new key range with only a lower bound.

parameters.name: lower
parameters.description: specifies the lower bound of the new key range.

parameters.name: open Optional
parameters.description: indicates whether the lower bound excludes the endpoint value. The default is false.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.upperBound()
members.description: Creates a new upper-bound key range.

members.name: IDBKeyRange.includes()
members.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether a specified key is inside the key range.
